pages.title: 16 ▪ The Tower ▪ פ
pages.text: Spirit of the Fire of Heaven

This card bears the picture of a tower, with its battlements struck by lightning; all people, both crowned and uncrowned, falling with the fragments of broken masonry.$(br)  It depicts mind in all its aspects; it also contains the first allusion to a material building.$(br)  It signifies the culmination of the spiritual word.$(br)  Some imagine that it is the downfall of the mind, seeking to penetrate the mystery of Creation; but it is rather the

ruin of the House of We, when evil has prevailed therein, and above all that it is the ruins of a House of Doctrine.$(br)  There is a sense in which the catastrophe is a reflection from the previous card, but not on the side of the symbolism which was indicated therein; $(l:patchouli:major/15the_devil)The Devil$() is concerned with the fall into the material and animal state, while this card signifies destruction on the intellectual side.

$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Painful or destructive experience, sometimes even violence.$(br)  The ultimate result is liberation.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  The experience is not as extreme, but also not as liberating.
